title.narrative: Build A New Home for Ebola Orphans in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: The Ebola Crisis left more than 4500 children as orphans. These children lost not only their parents, but also their homes - shelter and a safe place to sleep at night. The current Dream Home orphanage is a rented facility that is not ideal. It is not fenced, is on a hill and has no common dining room area that can seat the 22 kids at the home. Room layout and other options / facilities are not ideal. This project will build or purchase a new home to serve the needs of these young children.

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvester Renner, 1906 Knob Creek Road, Suite 3, Johnson City, Tennessee 37604, United States

title.narrative: Provide Care for Ebola Orphans in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: It's estimated that over 10,000 children in Sierra Leone, Africa were orphaned by the recent Ebola outbreak. Children of the Nations has undertaken to build a Care Center for up to 50 children orphaned by Ebola, where they will be able to heal and grow in a safe environment. COTN has been caring for orphaned children in Sierra Leone for twenty years. With your help we'll be able to reconnect some of these children with relatives and provide holistic care for those who have lost everything.

mailing-address.narrative: Kyle Donn, P.O. Box 3970, Silverdale, WA 98383, United States

title.narrative: Bringing Safe Water to Schools in Rural Liberia

description.narrative: FACE Africa is conducting a WASH in Schools program in remote Rivercess County, Liberia, aiming to keep children safe and healthy so that they can learn, grow and thrive as part of prosperous and resilient communities. Strengthening WASH in schools is also a key first step to a sustainable recovery from Ebola. This project will enable the expansion of our safe water point network to 10 new schools across the county, accompanied by the provision of comprehensive hygiene training and education.

mailing-address.narrative: Jennifer Connelly, 929 Massachusetts Aveue, Suite 01, Cambridge, MA 02139, United States

title.narrative: Help Liberian Kids Complete Their Education

description.narrative: The Liberian education system is still recovering from the Ebola Epidemic and a 14-year civil war. According to USAID, only 44% of primary age students attend primary school. At this dismal rate, the caliber of future leaders is at risk. We are helping to address this need by providing strategically needed resources - scholarships, uniforms, school supplies, school furniture, classrooms. This makes a huge difference - helping to keep kids in school and enhancing the quality of education.

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvester Renner, 1906 Knob Creek Road, Suite 3, Johnson City, Tennessee 37604, United States

title.narrative: Energizing Rural Health Services in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: Sierra Leone's health care system was exposed as underprepared and underperforming by the recent ebola outbreak, leaving the country in dire need of rebuilding and improving on the existing infrastructure. This project is supporting 3 hospitals and 22 clinics in rural Sierra Leone, providing them with sustainable solar electricity systems. As a co-funded project any dollar donated will be matched in a 3:1 ratio by an existing approved funding source from the EU Energy Facility.

mailing-address.narrative: Paul Munro, 95 Regent Road, Freetown, Western Area Urban N/A, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Beyond Ebola Making Handwashing a Habit in Liberia

description.narrative: The Ebola Virus Disease impact on Liberia was devastating and affected every sector of the Liberian Society. A post Ebola recovery plan is important and essential especially for schools in slums and rural parts of Liberia who prior to the Ebola outbreak did not have proper Water and sanitation facilities on campuses. The Beyond Ebola Making Handwashing a Habit in Liberia Project is aimed at improving WASH and Ebola prevention related activities at 20 selected schools in rural communities.

mailing-address.narrative: James Koryor, 1st Floor Sheila Cinema Building, Carey Street, Monrovia, Liberia, Monrovia, 1000, Liberia

title.narrative: Youth, Violence and Crime in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: After Ebola, over 60 % of youth are now unemployed in Sierra Leone. Many are currently at risk to violence and crime perpetuated by organised cliques/gangs in fragile cities in Sierra Leone. Change needs to happen within local communities or "Hot Spots areas". This project will train community youth leaders to effectively design and organise Dialogue Forums aimed at understanding the root causes, the recruitment patterns and priority needs of youth associated with cliques/gang in Sierra Leone.

organisation.narrative: Campaign for National Unity-Sierra Leone( CNU-SL)

mailing-address.narrative: Moiyatu Braima, 69 Victoria Street, Ohio, Ohio P.O.B. 14726-00800, United States

description.narrative: The objective of this project is to give educational support to 300 EVD affected Orphans in Sierra Leone with scholarship and learning materials in six communities within Western Area Rural District (WARD). The purpose of this project is also to contribute to addressing the challenges face by the Ebola school orphans of educational needs in the project communities in rural Freetown in the western area of Sierra Leone.

mailing-address.narrative: Abu Bakkarr Sesay, Mansaray Street, Devil Hole, WARD, Freetown, Wester Area 00232, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Support 300 Ebola Orphans in Sierra Leone E V D

description.narrative: Summary The objective of this project is to give educational support to 300 EVD affected Orphans in Sierra Leone with scholarship and learning materials in six communities within Western Area Rural District (WARD). The purpose of this project is also to contribute to addressing the challenges face by the Ebola school orphans of educational needs in the project communities in rural Freetown in the western area of Sierra Leone.

mailing-address.narrative: Abu Bakkarr Sesay, Mansaray Street, Devil Hole, WARD, Freetown, Wester Area 00232, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: The kids kitchen: daily meals in the wake of Ebola

description.narrative: The project will provide daily meals to the children of the We Are the Future kindergarten and primary school in Freetown, Sierra Leone. These children come from poor fishing communities where families have lost most of their income due to the Ebola outbreak that has devastated the country and its economy.

organisation.narrative: Bread and Water for Africa UK

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvia Costantini, 50 broadway, London, SW1H 0BL, United Kingdom

description.narrative: Summary The objective of this project is to give educational support to 300 EVD affected Orphans in Sierra Leone with scholarship and learning materials in six communities within Western Area Rural District (WARD). The purpose of this project is also to contribute to addressing the challenges face by the Ebola school orphans of educational needs in the project communities in rural Freetown in the western area of Sierra Leone.

mailing-address.narrative: Abu Bakkarr Sesay, Mansaray Street, Devil Hole, WARD, Freetown, Wester Area 00232, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: WeSurvive: Stories of the Ebola Outbreak

description.narrative: WeSurvive: Stories of the Ebola Outbreak is a web-based, oral history database that allows users to access a substantial collection of personal video testimonials from Ebola survivors, their family members, and other community members affected by the 2014 West African Ebola outbreak. We believe it is vital that West Africans contribute directly and significantly to the historical record and deepen both how this catastrophic Ebola outbreak and the region are understood.

mailing-address.narrative: Banker White, 90 Mirabel Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, United States

description.narrative: ONETrack International practices alternative orphan-care solutions around the world by introducing the Transition to Home approach to family reunification (first developed by our project, CameroonONE). ONETrack International is currently operating in The Gambia, Zimbabwe and Cambodia; in Liberia with children affected by Ebola epidemic; in Honduras with communities affected by the Migrant Caravan Crisis; and our team in Greece is trying to establish programs with Yazidi refugees.

mailing-address.narrative: Anna Cavolowsky, 28 Hawthorne St, Unit 1, Boston, MA 02119, United States

title.narrative: Emergency Response to the Ebola Outbreak in DRC

description.narrative: One week after the most recent Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) was declared over, the government confirmed new cases of the deadly virus in North Kivu. International Medical Corps' Emergency Response Team (ERT) was already in DRC responding to the most recent outbreak, in Equateur Province. The ERT is now working in North Kivu with the Ministry of Health to help with infection prevention, monitoring and surveillance, and building local response capacity.

mailing-address.narrative: Kelli Maddock, 12400 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90025, United States

title.narrative: Prevent the spread of Ebola in the DRC

description.narrative: The outbreak of Ebola has now been declared over in Equateur Province in the North-West of Democratic Republic of Congo. However a new outbreak has been discovered in the Beni region of DRC. To date, 33 people have died from the disease. Beni is a much more populated region and is also one of the most conflict affected. The result is that thousands of people are moving within and out of the region, which makes the disease much harder to contain.

mailing-address.narrative: Jake Ampleford, Oxfam House, John Smith Drive, Oxford, Oxfordshire OX4 2JY, United Kingdom

description.narrative: HDPSL is about to initiates environmental School boarding homes for children of mudslide and Ebola. It is certainty that this kids were neglected since they have lost both parents at hand, and we making it as a dream comes true to educate this children and to achieve their goals in the near future. We are determine to improve toilets, water facilities, greenery,educational new technologies, training teachers, etc; At this very moment they are living on temporary building which are not ideal,etc

mailing-address.narrative: Jim Morrison, P.O.BOX 1318, FREETOWN, SL, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Be pivotal in funding 30 children in Kori schools

description.narrative: The poverty state in Kori chiefdom, Moyamba district, is a result of the eleven years rebel war and Ebola Virus Disease (EVD). It has left so many children between the ages of 6 - 15 years as orphans and highly deprived. These children need education and safe lifestyles. The initiative will work within the community to raise awareness for education, and their rights to quality learning. It will provide school and life necessities/supplies as well.

organisation.narrative: Movement towards Education and Youth Empowerment-Sierra Leone

mailing-address.narrative: Augustine Macarthy, 4 Mannah Lane, Kennedy Section., Bo City, 0000, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Give Liberian Ebola Orphans a Home and Future

description.narrative: Children's Aid Liberia (CAL) seeks to build and maintain a children's home providing basic needs, sanctuary, security, shelter, food, care, education, love, and hope to the orphans of Liberia who have been impacted by the Ebola crisis and Liberian Civil War, preparing them to be productive and thriving members of society.

mailing-address.narrative: Nelson Dahn, Rehab Community, ELWA, Paynesville City, Monrovia (Paynesville), n/a, Liberia

title.narrative: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene For Orphanages

description.narrative: Health and Education are basic rights for children and essential elements of development and effective poverty reduction. The Ebola Virus Disease impact on Liberia was devastating and affected every sector of the Society. A post Ebola recovery program is essential for orphanages who prior to the outbreak did not have Proper Hygiene Education, Water and Sanitation Facilities, Limited Sanitary Supplies and other challenges. The Project seeks to provide Education and WASH Station for 7 Orphanage

mailing-address.narrative: Amos Sawboh, Carey & Johnson Street, Caesar's Building, Monrovia, 1000 Monrovia, Liberia

mailing-address.narrative: Amos Sawboh, Carey & Johnson Street, Caesar's Building, Monrovia, 1000 Monrovia, Liberia

title.narrative: Provide Life-Saving Medicine to Liberian Hospitals

description.narrative: The West Africa Ebola outbreak of 2014-2016 decimated the nation of Liberia, then recovering from civil wars (1980-2003). The outbreak closed clinics and hospitals as Liberia faced economic collapse. Healthcare in Liberia has not recovered and now the country faces the COVID-19 pandemic without the most basic of supplies. RESTORE HOPE: LIBERIA and Friends of Foya-Borma Hospital will send essential medicines and provide critically needed medical-surgical supplies to Kolahun and Foya Hospitals.

mailing-address.narrative: Saundra Williams, Old Road, Sinkor, Monrovia, N/A, Liberia

description.narrative: The CoronaVirus / COVID-19 is disrupting the lives and livelihood of lives globally. In response, we are targetting key areas - cleanliness education/sensitization, radios so kids can listen to educational broadcasts, provision of masks, soap, food items to alleviate hunger/crisis impact, and pregnancy prevention for teenage girls. This response is based on the successes and the lessons that we learned during our involvement in the Ebola Epidemic. We stand together. Together we will win.

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvester Renner, 1906 Knob Creek Road, Suite 3, Johnson City, Tennessee 37604, United States

title.narrative: Survivors Film & COVID19 | Trust Hope & Solidarity

description.narrative: We are making our film SURVIVORS available for free, streaming on PBS.org. The film chronicles the 2014 Ebola outbreak through the eyes of Sierra Leonean healthcare workers. Very, proud to share this film again at this time of great uncertainty and to highlight the inspiring self-sacrifice of Sierra Leonean workers and underscore the film's lessons about the importance of trust, transparency and community solidarity.

mailing-address.narrative: Banker White, 90 Mirabel Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response in Sierra Leone & Guinea Bissau

description.narrative: We are working in partnership with remote communities in rural Sierra Leone and Guinea-Bissau who lack basic sanitation facilities and knowledge on how disease spreads. These communities are particularly vulnerable to COVID-19 as well as Cholera, Ebola and other diseases. This project will work with communities to build hand-washing stations, clean water wells and provide training on how to prevent the spread of disease. This will give communities the tools they need to stay safe and healthy.

mailing-address.narrative: Antony Kingsley, 309 Greenford Road, Greenford, London, Middlesex UB6 8RE, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Save Lives in the World's Most Remote Villages

description.narrative: This project will support Last Mile Health as it recruits, trains, equips, manages, and pays professionalized community health workers - enabling them to provide health services through home visits, serving to heal and restore hope in post-war and post-Ebola Liberia.

mailing-address.narrative: Tommy Good, P.O. Box 130122, Boston, MA 02113, United States

title.narrative: Care for Chimp Infants Confiscated from Poachers

description.narrative: This project is focused on providing the initial care for chimpanzee and other primate infants confiscated from the illegal wildlife trade in northeastern DR Congo. Because of the current Ebola epidemic, our site in Epulu serves as the quarantine space for confiscated chimps and other primates before they are transferred to Lwiro Primate Sanctuary in Bukavu, DR Congo. As such, we are providing the medicine, food, surrogate care and additional needs for each chimpanzee infant.
